  • SEARCH: 
 

Package hr.fer.zemris.java.hw07.shell.commands

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ShellCommand
    Represents a command used in MyShell.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CatCommand
    The command is used to open the given file and write out its content.
    CdCommand
    The command is used to change the current working directory in MyShell.
    CharsetsCommand
    Lists names of supported charsets for current Java platform.
    CommandUtils
    Utils class that provides a function for command argument parsing.
    CopyCommand
    Copies the source file to destination file.
    CpTreeCommand
    The command copies the source directory into destination directory (recursively) i.e the whole directory structure under source directory is copied to destination.
    DropDCommand
    Pops the last directory from directory stack if the stack is not empty.
    ExitCommand
    The command terminates MyShell.
    HelpCommand
    Help command used in MyShell.
    HexdumpCommand
    Produces a hex output of a file from given filepath.
    ListDCommand
    Prints all directories stored on the directory stack using PushDCommand.
    LsCommand
    Writes a directory listing(not recursive), and basic information about all children directories and files.
    MassrenameCommand
    The command is used for massive renaming/moving files from source to destination directory.
    MkdirCommand
    Creates the desired directory structure from given path argument.
    PopDCommand
    Pops the path from the stack if the stack is not empty; and sets the current directory to the popped one if it exists.
    PushDCommand
    Pushes the current working directory on the stack and sets the new working directory.
    PwdCommand
    Prints the current working directory.
    RmTreeCommand
    Deletes the specified directory and all its contents (recursive).
    SymbolCommand
    The command is used to find out currently used action symbols - PROMPT, MORELINES, MULTILINE,
    or to set them to a new symbol.
    TreeCommand
    Writes a directory listing(recursive) as a tree.
